sub_topic: Identifying the planarity of a graph.
message_1:
Determine whether the graph shown below is planar or not.

![Graph Image](https://i.imgur.com/5xjIZks.png)
message_2:
To determine if a graph is planar, we can use Kuratowski's theorem, which states that a graph is planar if and only if it does not contain a subgraph that is homeomorphic to K5 (complete graph on 5 vertices) or K3,3 (complete bipartite graph on 3+3 vertices).

In the given graph, we can see that it contains a subgraph that is homeomorphic to K3,3. The subgraph can be formed by choosing the following vertices: A, B, C, D, E, and F. The connections between these vertices form a complete bipartite graph on 3+3 vertices.

A - D
A - E
A - F
B - D
B - E
B - F
C - D
C - E
C - F

Since the graph contains a subgraph homeomorphic to K3,3, it is non-planar according to Kuratowski's theorem.
